title: Explore the 10 Leading Circular Economy Examples in 2024 - StartUs Insights
summary: Green innovation, business innovation, green products, and green processes are all part of the circular economy, which is a sustainable alternative to the traditional linear economy.   The circular economy keeps waste out of the system, reuses resources, and promotes recycling and repair.  We provide examples of each of these concepts and give specific examples of them in use by companies.

title: Towards a Circular Plastics Economy: India's Actions to #BeatPlasticPollution - TERI
summary: This article discusses the growing problem of plastic pollution and the need for innovative solutions. It highlights the role of the informal recycling sector in India and the importance of a circular economy approach to plastic waste management. The article also provides recommendations for achieving a circular plastics economy in India.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses the need for innovative solutions to address the problem of plastic pollution.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article highlights the importance of a circular economy approach to plastic waste management, which involves design changes to restrict the plastics used in new products, increased engagement of brand owners with local authorities, and investment in end-of-life innovation.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses the need to develop recyclable, cost-effective plastics as a viable substitute to their non-recyclable counterpart and the importance of exploring and unlocking the market potential of recycled plastics.

title: Coastal Park Material Recovery Facility construction project on track - Democratic Alliance
summary: The City of Cape Town is constructing a large material recovery facility (MRF) at the Coastal Park landfill site. Once operational, the facility will allow for a dramatic increase in the diversion of recyclable materials from landfills in Cape Town. The facility is expected to start operating around mid-November 2024 and will create a minimum of 100 new jobs.
green_innovation: TRUE, the facility will allow for the diversion of recyclable materials from landfills, reducing environmental impact.
business_innovation: TRUE, the facility incorporates mechanical separation equipment and a training center for waste management education, representing a new and improved business process for waste management.
green_product: FALSE, the article does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: TRUE, the facility will use mechanical separation equipment to sort recyclable materials, representing a new and improved green process for waste management.

title: R186m recycling facility in Muizenberg set to operate in 2024 - CapeTown ETC
summary: A new recycling facility in Muizenberg, South Africa is on track to start operations in November 2024. The new material recovery facility (MRF) will process co-mingled clean and dry recyclables so that they can be sold and used to manufacture new products. Once complete, the R186 million MRF will have the capacity to sort 65 tonnes of recycled material per day.
green_innovation: TRUE, The new recycling facility will contribute to environmental sustainability goals by reducing the amount of waste going to landfills and by increasing the recycling rate of materials.
business_innovation: TRUE, The new recycling facility is a new and improved business process that differs significantly from the firm’s previous business processes and that has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: FALSE, The article does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: TRUE, The new recycling facility will use a variety of green processes to sort and recycle materials, including mechanical separation equipment, screens, conveyors, and baling facilities.

title: Construction of new recycling facility in Cape Town on track for completion next year - Creamer Media's Engineering News
summary: Cape Town is building a new material recovery facility (MRF) at the Coastal Park landfill site, which is expected to start operations in November 2023. The MRF will create a minimum of 100 jobs and have the capacity to sort 65 t of recycled material a day, which will allow the City of Cape Town to significantly expand its separation-at-source recycling collection program. The new development will also provide a nine-bay drop-off facility that will accept builders’ rubble, mixed waste, garden waste, as well as recyclables not taken by the MRF.
green_innovation: TRUE, the MRF contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing resource consumption and promoting recycling.
business_innovation: TRUE, the MRF is a new product or business process that differs significantly from the firm’s previous products or business processes and that has been introduced on the market or brought into use by the firm.
green_product: FALSE, the article does not describe a new green product.
green_process: TRUE, the MRF is a new business process that uses mechanical separation equipment to sort recycled materials, which reduces waste and conserves natural resources.
likely_naics_codes: ['562111 - Solid Waste Collection', '562112 - Hazardous Waste Collection', '562119 - Other Waste Collection', '562211 - Waste Treatment and Disposal']

title: Trash talk to dispel Townsville’s common waste myths - Townsville Bulletin
summary: This article is about the definitions of green innovation, business innovation, green product, green process, and greenwashing. It also provides examples of each.
